feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The transcript shows a working tool that computes budget vs. actual and variance across multiple financial categories, with visualization and explanatory framing for non-experts (Implement + Discover). Reflection confirms the app's usefulness and iterative development, demonstrating functional financial application behavior sufficient for a PASS.


AREAS FOR IMPROVEMENT:
- Integrate AI: The submission documents building a useful variance-explainer app (Discover/Implement/Reflect) but contains no explicit mention or example of AI capabilities (e.g., ML models, NLP, predictive analytics, or AI-driven automation). The evidence shows app functionality and coding iteration but not integration of AI, so it does not meet the criterion.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: "Here we have the total budget. So I made this model that kind of gives you a variance explainer to someone who wouldn't already know about it through finance."
"So I keep adding these items. Maybe it's salaries and wages marketing operations, technology, rent, travel and entertainment and professional services."
"This app is extremely useful in just finding the different variances, seeing what makes sense with your finances and how that money uh works together."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: student identified a problem (non-finance users need simpler variance explanations) and set the goal to build an accessible app.  
Implement: student describes adding financial line items and demonstrates code/model behavior (budget, actual, variance).  
Reflect: student reports usability insights and iteration (trial and error, usability for non-experts).
criteria.reasoning: The transcript shows a working tool that computes budget vs. actual and variance across multiple financial categories, with visualization and explanatory framing for non-experts (Implement + Discover). Reflection confirms the app's usefulness and iterative development, demonstrating functional financial application behavior sufficient for a PASS.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "I also wanted to create an app that a lot of other people could use, especially people that aren't involved in finance."
"So I keep adding these items. Maybe it's salaries and wages marketing operations, technology, rent, travel and entertainment and professional services."
"I was able to take a lot of trial and error. I first used to N-A-N, but I felt like it just wasn't cooperating this well. So I used to replet instead."
criteria.driver_alignment:
Discover: sets user-focused goal for an app (goal-setting evidence).  
Implement: shows iterative building and code demonstration (execution evidence).  
Reflect: shows learning and tooling choices (reflection evidence).
criteria.reasoning: The submission documents building a useful variance-explainer app (Discover/Implement/Reflect) but contains no explicit mention or example of AI capabilities (e.g., ML models, NLP, predictive analytics, or AI-driven automation). The evidence shows app functionality and coding iteration but not integration of AI, so it does not meet the criterion.
